benchmark_details.name: CLAW (Chinese Legal Knowledge Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: CLAW is a novel benchmark specifically engineered to meticulously evaluate Large Language Models (LLMs) on Chinese legal knowledge and its application in reasoning. It includes a corpus of all 306 Chinese national statutes segmented to the subparagraph level and a challenging set of 254 case-based reasoning instances derived from China Supreme Court curated materials.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of the benchmark is to evaluate the depth of Chinese legal knowledge and the efficacy of case-based legal reasoning in general-purpose LLMs.

data.source: A comprehensive corpus of 306 Chinese national statutes and 254 case-based reasoning instances from the Supreme Court of China.
data.annotation: Legal texts and reasoning cases are prepared based on authoritative sources and guidelines.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated as per defined tasks, focusing on hierarchical accuracy for ID Retrieval and similarity scores for Content Retrieval.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in legal knowledge recall and reasoning capabilities.
methodology.validation: Empirical validation through comparisons with leading LLMs.
